log.description: log message: any kind of logging you want the platform to know about.

state.description: schema message: the state. Must be the last message produced. The platform uses this information

trace.description: trace message: a message to communicate information about the status and performance of a connector

control.description: connector config message: a message to communicate an updated configuration from a connector that should be persisted

namespace.description: namespace the data is associated with

stream.description: stream the data is associated with

emitted_at.description: when the data was emitted from the source. epoch in millisecond.

meta.description: Information about this record added mid-sync

changes.description: Lists of changes to the content of this record which occurred during syncing

field.description: The field that had the change occur (required)

change.description: The type of change that occurred

reason.description: The reason that the change occurred

AirbyteStateType.description: The type of state the other fields represent. Is set to LEGACY, the state data should be read from the `data` field for backwards compatibility. If not set, assume the state object is type LEGACY. GLOBAL means that the state should be read from `global` and means that it represents the state for all the streams. It contains one shared state and individual stream states. PER_STREAM means that the state should be read from `stream`. The state present in this field correspond to the isolated state of the associated stream description.

recordCount.description: the number of records which were emitted for this state message, for this stream or global

stack_trace.description: an optional stack trace if the log message corresponds to an exception

emitted_at.description: the time in ms that the message was emitted

error.description: error trace message: the error object

estimate.description: Estimate trace message: a guess at how much data will be produced in this sync

stream_status.description: Stream status trace message:  the current status of a stream within a source

message.description: A user-friendly message that indicates the cause of the error

internal_message.description: The internal error that caused the failure

stack_trace.description: The full stack trace of the error

stream_descriptor.description: The stream associated with the error, if known (optional)

type.title: estimate type
type.description: Estimates are either per-stream (STREAM) or for the entire sync (SYNC). STREAM is preferred, and requires the source to count how many records are about to be emitted per-stream (e.g. there will be 100 rows from this table emitted). For the rare source which cannot tell which stream a record belongs to before reading (e.g. CDC databases), SYNC estimates can be emitted. Sources should not emit both STREAM and SOURCE estimates within a sync.

row_estimate.description: The estimated number of rows to be emitted by this sync for this stream

byte_estimate.description: The estimated number of bytes to be emitted by this sync for this stream

AirbyteStreamStatus.description: The current status of a stream within the context of an executing synchronization job.

stream_descriptor.description: The stream associated with the status

status.description: The current status of the stream

AirbyteAnalyticsTraceMessage.description:
A message to communicate usage information about the connector which is not captured by regular sync analytics because it's specific to the connector internals.
This is useful to understand how the connector is used and how to improve it. Each message is an event with a type and an optional payload value (both of them being strings). The event types should not be dynamically generated but defined statically. The payload value is optional and can contain arbitrary strings.

type.description: The event type - should be a static string. Keep in mind that all strings are shared across all connectors.

value.description: The value of the event - can be an arbitrary string. In case the value is numeric, it should be converted to a string. Casting for analytics purposes can happen in the warehouse.

emitted_at.description: the time in ms that the message was emitted

connectorConfig.description: connector config orchestrator message: the updated config for the platform to store for this connector

config.description: the config items from this connector's spec to update

json_schema.description: Stream schema using Json Schema specs.

supported_sync_modes.description: List of sync modes supported by this stream.

source_defined_cursor.description: If the source defines the cursor field, then any other cursor field inputs will be ignored. If it does not, either the user_provided one is used, or the default one is used as a backup.

default_cursor_field.description: Path to the field that will be used to determine if a record is new or modified since the last sync. If not provided by the source, the end user will have to specify the comparable themselves.

source_defined_primary_key.description: If the source defines the primary key, paths to the fields that will be used as a primary key. If not provided by the source, the end user will have to specify the primary key themselves.

namespace.description: Optional Source-defined namespace. Currently only used by JDBC destinations to determine what schema to write to. Airbyte streams from the same sources should have the same namespace.

cursor_field.description: Path to the field that will be used to determine if a record is new or modified since the last sync. This field is REQUIRED if `sync_mode` is `incremental`. Otherwise it is ignored.

primary_key.description: Paths to the fields that will be used as primary key. This field is REQUIRED if `destination_sync_mode` is `*_dedup`. Otherwise it is ignored.

connectionSpecification.description: ConnectorDefinition specific blob. Must be a valid JSON string.

supportsIncremental.description: (deprecated) If the connector supports incremental mode or not.

supportsNormalization.description: If the connector supports normalization or not.

supportsDBT.description: If the connector supports DBT or not.

supported_destination_sync_modes.description: List of destination sync modes supported by the connector

advanced_auth.description:
Additional and optional specification object to describe what an 'advanced' Auth flow would need to function.
  - A connector should be able to fully function with the configuration as described by the ConnectorSpecification in a 'basic' mode.
  - The 'advanced' mode provides easier UX for the user with UI improvements and automations. However, this requires further setup on the
  server side by instance or workspace admins beforehand. The trade-off is that the user does not have to provide as many technical
  inputs anymore and the auth process is faster and easier to complete.

predicate_key.description: Json Path to a field in the connectorSpecification that should exist for the advanced auth to be applicable.

predicate_value.description: Value of the predicate_key fields for the advanced auth to be applicable.

protocol_version.description: the Airbyte Protocol version supported by the connector. Protocol versioning uses SemVer.
